attributes.action: London should remain part of the European Union
attributes.additional_details:
Londoners contribute 70% more of the UK's national income than people in the rest of the country each year - a difference of £16,000 per person - and the capital generates 22% of all annual UK economic growth, despite accounting for only 12.5% of the population.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36526298
attributes.background: London's majority population have voted to remain part of the European Union. One pound in every five earned by Londoners is used to fund the rest of the country, a report has revealed. Therefore London should be able to have a different agreement and remain part of the European Union
